ref: 14668a *paddhara -- ʻ level, straight ʼ. [Cf. prādhvaná -- ʻ bed or course of a river ʼ RV., prādhvara -- (unexpl. epithet of śākhā -- ʻ branch ʼ) Cat., prādhva -- ʻ *advancing, *straight ʼ (ʻ travelling ʼ Pāṇ.com., ˚vē ʻ at the head of ʼ Kāṭh., ˚vam ʻ suitably, properly ʼ R., ʻ conformably ʼ Āpast. -- prādhva -- X prahva -- in prādhvaṁ kr̥tvā ʻ laying down ʼ MBh., prādhvam ʻ humbly ʼ Hcar.); paddhara -- < prādhvara -- would be (rather than an ancient r/n variant of prādhvaná -- ) a MIA. ext. of prādhva -- ~ *prādhva -- t -- in paddhati -- f. ʻ way ʼ Hariv., *prādhva -- ḍ -- in paddhoḍī -- (musical term) Saṁgīt., *prādhvā -- r -- in *paddhārayati (Pk. pādhāraī with EMIA. ādh < āddh) ʻ travels ʼ. -- paddharaṇī -- (sthālī -- ) f. ʻ (bowl) for collecting the scooped footprint of the soma -- cow ʼ ŚrS. (Caland -- Henry Agniṣṭoma p. 38) conceived of by pop. etym. as containing pad -- haraṇa<-> (J. C. W.). -- ádhvan -- ]
